articles.author: Navdeep Singh
articles.title: Sensex, Nifty trade lower amid losses in HDFC twins - The Economic Times
articles.description: In the Sensex pack, HDFC and HDFC Bank were the top losers, falling 1-2%. Maruti, M&M, IndusInd Bank, Kotak Bank and Axis Bank also opened with cuts. On the flip side, Sun Pharma, Asian Paints, Infosys, Wipro and Nestle opened with gains.
articles.content: Amid mixed Asian markets, Indian equity indices opened flat with a negative bias on Tuesday. The gains from index heavyweights Infosys, TCS and Reliance were offset by losses in HDFC twins and ITC.Th… [+2736 chars]

articles.author: Jihye Lee, Lim Hui Jie
articles.title: Asia markets largely rise ahead of key Chinese data releases for April - CNBC
articles.description: Market watchers were largely expecting a rebound in growth, but the economic data for April widely missed expectations as the economy continued to show an uneven recovery path.
articles.content:
Gas will be at the front and center of discussions at the Group of Seven summit meeting later this week, S&P Global's Vice Chairman Daniel Yergin told CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia."
